verses.roman:
ei cabbiśa mūrti--prābhava-vilāsa pradhāna
astra-dhāraṇa-bhede dhare bhinna bhinna nāma

synonyms: ei cabbiśa mūrti—all of these twenty-four forms; prābhava-vilāsa—pastime forms of the prābhava expansions; pradhāna—chief; astra-dhāraṇa—of holding the weapons; bhede—in terms of differences; dhare—accept; bhinna bhinna—separate from one another; nāma—names.
translation: "All these twenty-four forms constitute the chief prābhava-vilāsa pastime forms of the Lord. They are named differently according to the position of weapons in Their hands.
